RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a spire.
Two Nomai waited outside this tower to travel to the Deep Storm Station.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a spire.
Two Nomai debated about the Sun Station, while waiting outside this warp tower to travel to something called the Deep Storm Station.
Nomai traveled to a new warp pad installed on the Construction Yard to enter the Deep Storm Station.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin that resembles column formations.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin that resembles column formations.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a mountain.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a mountain.
A Nomai named Cycad delivered a message to Timber Hearth, informing the Nomai there about an issue on Ash Twin.
After studying the issue, Oeno concluded that the issue was caused by something called the sunless tide.
Oeno suggested traveling to the other tower with the same issue to better demonstrate her findings.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin with pointed edges.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin with pointed edges.
The rotating doors on Ash Twin can be activated without input by a phenomenon called the sunless tide.
The sunless tide occurs as the Hourglass Twins align directly with the sun, causing a combined force of gravity that causes both sand and vision orbs to be pulled towards the twin closer to the sun.
As this alignment occurs, a solar eclipse occurs on the body farther from the sun.

RumorFact.Text: Two towers on Ash Twin joined together by an arch.

ExploreFact.Text: Two towers on Ash Twin joined together by an arch.
